label: Andr
content: Please don't blame the original developer for 'abandoning' this project

label: Andr
content: The Mob Talker Mod is deceptively complicated due to a simple thing...

label: Andr
content: The developer must create a DSL or a Domain Specific Language

label: Andr
content: This is what the original Mob Talker Script looks like...

label: Andr
content: Think about it, you have to translate this script into something that Minecraft can read

label: Andr
content: In essence, you're creating an entire Programming Language and a Game Engine

label: Andr
content: Not to mention you have to make the programming language interop with Java and run the Game Engine inside of Minecraft

choice.label: cool
choice.display: Oh, okay cool, so how did the dev do it?

label: Andr
content: Good Question

label: Andr
content: Lua seems to be an obvious choice. It is lightweight and many mods rely on it.

label: Andr
content: Why not write the script in Lua? Define a few methods to control the screen?

label: Andr
content: The main problem faced by the dev of *this* mod, is that Lua is an Interpreted Language

label: Andr
content: Java on the other hand is compiled language

label: Andr
content: What happens is that Java will try to run the entire script at once...

label: Andr
content: Getting Java to interpret lua line by line is extremely hard, you see?

label: Andr
content: This is most likely why most people abandoned this project

label: Andr
content: An experienced Java Developer would understand how hard it is to get Lua or any scripting language to Interop with Java

label: Andr
content: A non experienced Java developer would just get stuck after realizing they need to make a new programming language for this

label: Andr
content: Because, to recreate this mod properly, you HAVE to make something that a community can use

label: Andr
content: A way to create a DSL that is human readable and can be read by java.

label: Andr
content: And thus, the developer of this mod, created this

label: Andr
content: This is a DSL written in Python.

label: Andr
content: Instead of getting Lua to interop with Java, the developer sidestepped this problem entirely

label: Andr
content: The developer created a Python SDK Framework that translates python-dsl readable script...

label: Andr
content: Into Json FSM (Finite State Machine)

label: Andr
content: This Json FSM is very easy to interpret and read in Java

label: Andr
content: All the dev has to do is to make a simple class that can read the Json FSM

label: Andr
content: Mod creator and players can just put this Json FSM into the mod Config folder.

label: Andr
content: And that's a little history of how this mod is created

label: Andr

label: Andr
content: Making the script is simple.

label: Andr
content: Well you need to use the Mob Talker SDK to create a script

label: Andr
content: https://github.com/Iteranya/MobTalkerSDK

label: Andr
content: Can you click that link? Probably not...

label: Andr
content: But yes, using the SDK, it will turn the human readable script into Json

label: Andr
content: More information on how to use the SDK can be found in the github page

label: Andr
content: That json will then be sent to the minecraft mod to read. Any question?

label: Andr
content: This mod is surprisingly compatible and easy to maintain.

label: Andr
content: Due to a lack of Java Interop and separation of concerns... The only 'modded' part is the screen/gui

label: Andr
content: The Game Engine that reads the Json FSM is written in Pure Java

label: Andr
content: You don't even have to worry about cross-version script compatiblity

label: Andr
content: Personally I love this approach, the Mob Talker Mod might become timeless again!
